alert.note: Alert for Greene (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 03 at 6:34PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following county, Greene. * WHEN...Until 945 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greeneville, Tusculum, Mosheim, Mohawk, Chucky and Davy Crockett Birthplace. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
